ie.stu.papercut

Annotation Type RemoveThis


  • @Retention(value=SOURCE)
 @Target(value={METHOD,FIELD,TYPE,CONSTRUCTOR})
public @interface RemoveThis
    Mark some code that you want to remove from your codebase in the future. The default behavior for a plain annotation is to fail your build. You can provide descriptive text, set a code expiration date, or version number, switch from failures to warnings, or use Milestones for managing the removal.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      java.lang.String date
      Specify a date at which the item should be removed.
      java.lang.String milestone
      Specify a milestone by which the code should have been removed.
      boolean stopShip
      Specify whether a failure to meet the removal condition should break the build.
      java.lang.String value
      Specify a string that can be used to describe when to remove some code if there's no known date.
      java.lang.String versionCode
      Specify a versionCode by which the code should have been removed.
      java.lang.String versionName
      Specify a versionName by which the code should have been removed.

    • Element Detail

      • value

        public abstract java.lang.String value
        Specify a string that can be used to describe when to remove some code if there's no known date.
        Returns:
        Descriptive text to identify when code should be removed
        Default:
        ""

      • date

        public abstract java.lang.String date
        Specify a date at which the item should be removed. Currently only YYYY-MM-DD format is supported.
        Returns:
        The date by which the refactor should be completed
        Default:
        ""

      • stopShip

        public abstract boolean stopShip
        Specify whether a failure to meet the removal condition should break the build. Defaults to true.
        Returns:
        Whether to fail your build or not
        Default:
        true

      • milestone

        public abstract java.lang.String milestone
        Specify a milestone by which the code should have been removed. Must exactly match a Milestone annotation specified somewhere in your codebase.
        Returns:
        The Milestone to remove code by
        Default:
        ""

      • versionCode

        public abstract java.lang.String versionCode
        Specify a versionCode by which the code should have been removed. Must be able to be parsed as an integer as performed by Integer.parseInt().
        Returns:
        The versionCode to remove code by
        Default:
        ""

      • versionName

        public abstract java.lang.String versionName
        Specify a versionName by which the code should have been removed. Must meet the semantic versioning specification to be supported, e.g. MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH
        Returns:
        The versionName to remove code by
        See Also:
        http://semver.org
        Default:
        ""
